alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Northern Washoe County; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 4:15AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...UNSEASONABLE HEAT THIS WEEKEND WITH FLOODING CONCERNS ACROSS AREA WATERWAYS DUE TO EXCESSIVE SNOWMELT AND RUNOFF... ...INCREASED THUNDERSTORM CHANCES THIS WEEKEND... Heat: * Highs will remain 10-15 degrees above average this weekend, which translates to around 90 degrees across western Nevada valleys and mid-to-upper 70s for Sierra valleys. Some record high temperatures are even possible today. This unseasonable heat introduces a moderate heat risk for sensitive individuals in warmer western Nevada valleys. Snowmelt and River Rises: * Increasing heat will also lead to increased snowmelt this weekend. If planning outdoor recreation, avoid streams and rivers as they will flow fast, cold, and high. While it may seem like a good idea to jump into the rivers to cool off, the water is extremely cold and shock can quickly set in, causing loss of motor function. There are also likely to be snow bridges present in the backcountry with water flowing beneath. Use extreme caution. * River observations indicate the mainstem and West Fork of the Walker River has reached minor flood stage, with the East Fork of the Walker forecast to reach minor flood stage this weekend. For more detailed river forecasts, visit www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. Shower and Thunderstorm Chances: * Shower and thunderstorm chances will increase each day this weekend with a 30% chance on Saturday, then up to 40% on Sunday. Main threats include gusty outflow winds of 40-50 mph, small hail, and localized heavy rainfall will be possible in the vicinity of any thunderstorms.
